chapter.id: Introduction to the TDF Operating System
chapter.title: Introduction to the TDF Operating System
chapter.para: Welcome to the tours de force version of the MPX Operating System! This was created for the Operating Systems course (CS 450) at West Virginia University for the Spring 2009 semester. The members of tours de force are Tim Bielawa, Andrew Butcher, Jack Dehlin, and Bryant Doss. The homepage of tours de force may be found at http://www.ducksarepeople.com/tdf.

section.title: About MPX
section.para: The MPX Operating System, which is shorthand for MultiProgramming eXecutive, is a project that was created by Malcolm Lane and James Mooney and published in the Project Manual of A Practical Approach to Operating Systems.

MPX is programmed using C, and is designed to simulate low-level functionality, though it will use an underlying MS-DOS installation for hardware abstraction. MPX operates exclusively in the command-line interface, and all commands and operations will have to be called by a shell.
